files

Class ActionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • files.ActionController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

     class ActionController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Controls all ActionEvents fired from all buttons in the program. It determines what happens depending on what button was pressed
    Version:
    4 June 12th, 2012
    version 3 changes - Added more actions for buttons
    version 4 changes - added code for more buttons, added comfirmation(),getLevel() and setLevel()
    Author:
    Calvin Chan, JunHee Cho

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ActionController(MainMenu parent, GameScreen gameScreen)
      Contructor which keeps a reference variable of the mainmenu program where it was created in and the gameScreen.

      Asks the user a question and returns the answer

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActionController

        public ActionController(MainMenu parent,
                GameScreen gameScreen)
        Contructor which keeps a reference variable of the mainmenu program where it was created in and the gameScreen.
        Parameters:
        parent - The mainmenu program which created this class. Needed to call methods from it.
        gameScreen - the GameScreen object connected to the mainMenu.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        The method that is called when a button is pressed. It determines which button was pressed and what to do.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - Contains information about the event in which the button was pressed Variable Dictionary 
        Name                  Type                 Description
        temp                  String               stores the action command (the button pressed)
